We have a good fifty or so documented instances of illegal stocking around the state and of course this
A way underestimate because those are the only ones that come to our attention basic biology tells you that there have been many more attempts that haven't succeeded to where the fish having established themselves as a population so they never come to our attention
You want to think of a fishing people as you know kind of conscientious conservationists and yet you have this example of at least a handful of people because they want to catch a certain kind of fish or dumped those fish in a reservoir where they don't belong
I'm sure that it is a handful of people I Would bet you that Ninety nine plus percent of our anglers are people who would never consider doing something like this but a small minority can cause a lot of damage for us what kind of damage
I'm bringing a case of Pistorius as we've seen in the past what you get when you put a top level
Predator like that into a body of water that doesn't have one is those fish are going to go like gangbusters for awhile and seemed to be doing well because they are eating all the fish that all the prey base
But once said prey base is gone then I'm you're going to end up with a large number of stunted skinny
Fish egg lawyers call on hammer handles um northern pike are very susceptible to this says are a lot of other species
So you will eventually end up with a fishery that nobody wants to fish at
Do you know how someone carries out this illegal stocking do you just like drive up with a big tank of fish or go out on the boat or something or what
[laughter] I'm One part of the problem is that it's pretty easy to do an pretty hard to get caught at you know fish can be moved in
Tanks they can be moved in bode well they can be moved short distances you know just in a bucket if you put your mind to it it's not terribly hard to keep the fish alive for a few hours and transport it from one place to another
And you can drop a relatively small number of these northern pike for example into the reservoir and then before long there's a much greater number
[noise] um let me think about this because I don't want to be necessarily giving people like cookbook for how to do this [laughter] that's definitely true you know if the fish they get moved are adults and their of reproductive age
And they happened to get stock into a place where they can survive then uh it doesn't take many fish to get a population started
Does the state try to convince people who fish that this is a bad idea to kind of take ecosystems into your own hands this way
We definitely do we have information about that on the back of our fishing pressure at the counter when you buy a life is on our website information that our law enforcement personnel handout I'm so we try and a lot of ways to get the word out
And of course there are substantial penalties if you happen to get caught and we can make a case against you you can be fined up to ten thousand dollars there's possibility that you can do jail time you can be responsible for the cost of remediation are but you would also hope that people would just want to do the right thing
